content.description: This is an excellent finger crack with fun, steep movement, though unfortunately marred by a few big features off to its left. Start with big flake and pocket moves about five feet to the left of the crack (there is a direct start with a couple 5.11 crack moves, which few people ever do). Follow up the crack to a good stance at a horizontal underneath a roof. Move right, and enjoy amazing movement up the crack, saving some juice for the devious and often-wet finish. Ends on bolted anchors.
content.protection: Nuts and cams to 2"  2 shuts at the top.
content.location: From the main Junkyard area walk downstream to the bouldering cave. The route is about 150 feet past the bouldering cave.

content.description:
Squirm and squiggle up the prominent wide crack in the corner to a sling anchor under the roof.  Check the anchor before committing to it -- it's looking a bit aged.

Variation: From the anchor, it is possible to traverse right (5.10b R) to finish up the 5.11b roof crack of Childbirth.  This was climbed by Andrew Barry in 1985.
content.protection: Gear up to wide hands. The sling anchor off of fixed gear at the top of the route stays in pretty good shape due to ample shade and the cap roof, but take care to inspect and replace it all the same.
content.location: Continue past Zealous downstream, past a shed-sized boulder, around a buttress, under some roofs, to a capped alcove corner. Squids in Bondage is the obvious corner crack with a steep, thrutchy start.

content.description: This was a little more fun and a little less straightforward than anticipated. Climb the chimney to a cool exit sequence, then wander left and up the face, finding finnicky gear on the way
content.protection: standard, but upper face is tricky with gear
content.location: Behind the shagbark hickory, duh. The corner just left of Junkyard bouldering cave

content.description: Steep jugs and horizontals to right facing corner up to ledge. very pumpy for the grade and some tricky placements.
content.protection: standard rack. shares anchors with Chasing Spiders.
content.location: Right of Chasing spiders, up on the ledge. below the right end of the high roof.

content.description: Short, sustained, and fun finger crack that stays dry in light rain. The crux is right off the ground, but is avoidable by following the block feature to the left.
content.protection: The crux is protectable with a #1 Trango ballnut/ #00 TCU (or just have a good spotter). Gear up to red camalot, and be ready to replace the tat at the shared anchor.
content.location: Continue past Zealous, past a shed-sized boulder, around a buttress, under some roofs, to an obvious capped corner. Faith Crack is the obvious finger crack just left of the corner (which is "Squids in Bondage" 5.9).

content.description:
Start on the left side of the ledge (where it is still comfortable to walk along the ledge) and climb up the dihedral to the bolts at the top.

The guidebook suggests continuing right under the large roof and exiting in the corner at the top there.
content.location: Far left side of the Zealous Wall, at the ledge where the buttress sends the path down below toward Dog Wall.

content.description: If this route was at a more traveled area, had top anchors, or even got cleaned up a little, it would be classic. Start with steep moves, trending up and left toward some mini-roofs, left-facing flakes, and eventually some discontinuous cracks. Continue up, eventually topping out by way of a larger, steep right-facing corner that is visible from the ground. The final topout move is straight out of HP40.
content.protection: Standard NRG face-trad rack, slings, and something for a tree anchor up top.
content.location: Between Zealous and the Squids in Bondage area is a prominent protruding buttress with about four face-trad routes on it. Brown Dirt Cowboy starts on the right-ish side of the buttress, just left of a tree, and just right of where a small overhang starts undercutting the wall.

content.description: It's what you might become if you chose the wrong major in college. It's also what you might need to be for this rig! Burl your way up through the flaring chimney maw then try not to pump out as you decipher the right path up and right through dicontinuous cracks on the headwall.
content.location: Begin in a large chimney crack corner system left of Zealous
